topics.body:
"@twistedmetalero":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5368991a636872541c4c0200#post_5368991a636872541c4c0200
Cause in real life, there are but a few notable people and most of the time, you're not one of them.
In the Internet, it's like being a popstar or someone famous at a never ending crazy party filled with other popstars and famous people. It's like everyone knows you.

topics.body: I have some news to tell you all, you all actually do know me, in fact I know every single one of you.

"@Background Pony #5B67":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53689ad5636872278fd70000#post_53689ad5636872278fd70000

Maybe cause i dont feel connectedat all with real life people, like i dont feel i belong there, only like 2 people are weird like that and i like them, and 1 of them is family.

Meanwhile i feel more related to internet people, hell i like internet people more than real ones, my second best friend lives in washington for christ sake, and i dont even know his face.

topics.body:
"@trashboat":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53689c4463687251a2130000#post_53689c4463687251a2130000
Seraphim and Number1pegasus' sentence structures while on here are similar to each others, so it's hard to guess which off just their way of typing.  What I mean by that is even when people on here are typing anonymously it's super easy to tell who is who, but sometimes if two people have a similar way of talking it's hard to tell.

Thats what i get for napping in the evening, i cant go to sleep.
